intro: Psychotria mima, commonly known as the Mima psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in the understory of tropical forests. Psychotria mima is also known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
